name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be meet or exceed the test values of Bentosure NW4000.
Frequency - Atleast 2 days prior to placement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NZTA F/07 Strength Class C & Filter Class 1 geotextile is to be used to wrap 20/40 drainage aggregate. Confirm before placement
Verifying Document - Technical Datasheet Delivery Dockets or photos

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage aggregate should be deep washed and in accordance with TNZ F/6 including gradings (40/20 aggregate). Open course grade clean durable aggregate, Have a crushing resistance of no less than 100kN when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991
Test 3.11 Meet the following gradings when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991, Test 3.8.1:
App B - HAM2018-0136AJ Rev. 1 Geotechnical Works Specification:
Table 2: Filter Material Gradings (Geotextile Wrapped Aggregate)

Frequency - Material Tests every 1000m³ or change of source. Visual inspection every load, verifying document photos of material onsite, if visual appearance changes, additional testing will be required.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage pipes used in subsoil drainage shall be smooth bore perforated corrugated 110 mm diameter Class 200 complying with NZTA F5 unless otherwise stated on the drawings. Pipes shall not have a geofabric filter sock unless requested by the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of pipes onsite with tag showing class
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - (2A SAND) 10mm clean well graded sand transition layer with minimal fines, void ratio 0.3.
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of sand onsite
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filter/ Planting Media must follow the specification as per RITS 4.2.19. Seen below.
Planting media is to be as per RITS 4.2.19.
Raingarden media should meet the following specifications:
○ Saturated Hydraulic Conductivity: 50 to 300 mm hr^-1.
○ Total phosphorus: Leachate testing required if > 100mg kg^-1
○ Media sources: From a clean source (no waste products)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Clean GAP65 to be used as Rip Rap. For soil filled scour protection a ratio of 30% topsoil, 70% GAP65.
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of mix
○ Mat (Coir Mat). Biodegradable mulching fabric 450 gsm
Standard / Specification - DWG 2195 REV1. Schedule SP2 4.3.7
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of mat onsite
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Check set-out prior to excavation of Rain Garden.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Excavations shall be completed in such manner that it is true to the drawings will allow novacoil to be laid true to the depths, grades and lines.
Frequency - Prior to laying filter cloth

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL Liner to be fixed to kerb as per manufacturers guidelines (Bentofix GCL 18.2, figure 14). Mechanical fasteners with stainless steel batten (connection bar) to be used to fix the liner to the kerb. Mechanical fasteners to be fixed 5 times ever meter of along the connection bar.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL Liner to be sealed around pavement drains and stormwater lines which connect into rain garden. Sealing shall be completed as per manufacturers guidelines (Bentofix GCL 18.3 & 18.4 Figuire 15). GCL shall be cut with a sharp utility knife. For horizontal pipes, vertical laps of min 1m are required. Inside the rain garden a clamp shall be used anchor the GCL lap to the pipe. Bentonite paste shall be be used in the void between the main GCL and GCL lap to ensure a water tight seal.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be repaired as per manufacture's guidelnes (Bentofix PVB5100c). GCL becomes damaged, torn or punctured during installation, the affected area should be repaired. For damaged areas, a separate piece of GCL shall be used and extend past the comprimised section by 500mm in every direction. Bentonite shall be used to connect the seperate GCL to the main liner.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be installed as per manufacturers guide and true to the drawings.The inspection should include overlaps, alignments, penetrations, connections, detections of any defects, including installation damage.
○ Detected falsely installed areas shall be marked, repaired and the repairs shall be inspected and approved engineer.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All geotextiles shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Bedding thickness shall be no less than 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Joining the pipe shall be done using a purpose made pullout resistant coupling in accordance with manufacturers recommendations
Verifying Document - Copy of delivery dockets, photos of joins onsite with tag showing class
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Grade of subsoils must be falling in the correct direction based on the IFC Drawings and at the correct grade (greater than 1% based on TNZ F/5)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pipe to have 100mm of drainage aggregate as top cover for pipe.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sand to be placed at a constant thickness of 100mm. Sand should be free of peaks and troughs.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filter media to be placed at a constant average thickness of 600mm, refer to drawing for detail. Filter media should be free of peaks and troughs.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mat shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Scour protection shall be installed as per drawings around let downs, scruffy dome and the flush point end.
Verifying Document - Site Photos/ Survey Data
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting including, initial subgrade level, all undercuts, all test location points, and final level
Frequency - As-builts taken every 10m prior to backfill

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen.To show all subsoils, including temporary subsoils that become part of the permanent works, to show all outlet locations
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum subgrade, undercuts, all service ducting/pipe lines immediately before backfill, warning tape / mag slabs immediately before backfill.
